variants.name: Standard FR-4
limitations: Not suitable for multiple lead-free reflow cycles

variants.name: High-Tg FR-4
variants.trenchInsight: Look at Td (Decomposition Temperature) not just Tg. Low Td causes resin breakdown during 3rd/4th reflow.

categories.name: High-Frequency / RF Laminates
categories.description: Materials for RF circuits that don't absorb signal

variants.name: PTFE (Teflon)
variants.trenchInsight: Pure PTFE is soft like cheese. Smears when drilled. Requires Plasma Etch or Sodium Naphthalene etch before plating.

variants.name: Polyimide (Kapton)
issues: Hygroscopic - absorbs up to 3% moisture by weight
variants.processControl: MUST bake (125°C for 4-24 hours) immediately before reflow to prevent delamination

variants.name: PET (Polyester)
limitations: Used with conductive ink or crimps only

variants.name: MCPCB (Metal Core PCB)
variants.description: Copper layer, thin dielectric, thick Aluminum or Copper backing

tg.name: Glass Transition Temperature
tg.description: Temperature at which the material transitions from rigid to soft

td.name: Decomposition Temperature
td.description: Temperature at which the resin chemically breaks down

dk.name: Dielectric Constant
dk.description: Measure of how much the material slows down electromagnetic waves

df.name: Dissipation Factor
df.description: Measure of signal loss in the material

cte.name: Coefficient of Thermal Expansion
cte.description: Rate at which material expands with temperature
